TopicTitle: [Tutorial] how to make a craft compatible with the version you want!

Articles.Content:
You have to open the file of the craft,and check for the version (up on the page,on the left),all you have to do is change the version to the version you like!

The screenshot highlight the line I am talking about.

Edited October 12, 2012 by sal_vager
Wow, never knew it was this easy. Thanks!

It isn't xD

Sometimes it is, but often it isn't. For example...

If your craft uses a part that was changed in the interim between versions (e.g., the Mk1 command pod), you then have to open it in the VAB/SPH and make sure it's OK. In some cases you have to reattach parts.
I've tested with a demo craft(the command pod have changed since that version),the only probleme I had was a solid fuel engine misplacement(was in the pod intead of under it).
Have you actually tried to fly the craft? I think it's recommended to reattach the CM to avoid glitches.

I just have tried,the part just did like if there were not attached.

But with the plane I did in 0.16,it worked!
